trans-unit.target: TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SEQ_00<tab>Y'shtola appears deep in thought.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_00<tab>Speak with Y'shtola.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_01<tab>Inspect the Ondo Cups from the survey point.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_02<tab>Use the mythril knife to collect scrapings from the remnant wall.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_03<tab>Speak with Y'shtola.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_04<tab>Find a structure which resembles those in the copy of the Qitana Ravel mural, then inspect it from the survey point.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_TODO_05<tab>Speak with Y'shtola.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_000<tab>...Ah, <var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>. Have you learned aught of note?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_001<tab>Fascinating...and precisely the sort of information I was hoping to hear.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_002<tab>In fact, if you have a moment, I'd like to borrow your eyes to confirm a theory I've been working on. Come.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_010<tab>Now, there are two tasks I would have you perform.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_011<tab>The first requires you to inspect the buildings which surround the Ondo settlement, and note their most distinctive characteristics.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_012<tab>For the second, I wish you to use this knife to take scrapings from one of the remnant walls.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_013<tab>Pray be as thorough as you can. I shall be waiting here for the results of your investigations.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_020<tab>'Tis strange to be here, under the ocean. It seems a lifetime ago that we stood amidst the trees of Rak'tika...

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_030<tab>Inspect the structures of the Ondo Cups for distinctive features. You may move the camera, as well as zoom in and out. Target a building and examine it with <var 08 E4E95101 ((<var 48 F20222 /var><var 48 01 /var>)) ((<var 1E 10 /var> / <var 1E 09 /var>)) /var>.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_040<tab>You set the point of the knife against the wall, but even after applying considerable pressure, you cannot remove so much as a flake of stone.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_050<tab>And what have you discovered?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_051<tab>Yes, I would agree that the windows are most distinctive. 'Twould seem the structures appear the same to both your sight and mine...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_052<tab>And you say you could not so much as scratch the wall? Even with all your might behind the blade?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_053<tab><var 2C ((<var 29 EB02 /var>)) (( )) 02 /var>, everywhere I turn in this place, my gaze is drawn by peculiar materials for which I do not have a name.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_054<tab>The buildings I had you investigate are prime examples. They may appear to be constructed of ordinary stone, but I assure you it is nothing of the sort...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_055<tab>If pressed, I would describe the substance as a composite of several mineral properties, blended to create a material of unparalleled durability.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_056<tab>Even the Ronkan Empire, once the greatest power in Norvrandt, produced nothing which compares to this level of perfection.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_057<tab>But if not the Ronkans, then who? Who were these ancients the Ondo claim as the architects of their sanctuary?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_058<tab>I suspect our answer lies with the reason Emet-Selch withdrew here to the Tempest.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_059<tab>He may simply have wished to retreat somewhere mere mortals would struggle to reach...but there are many such remote locations. Why here, specifically?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_060<tab>Emet-Selch is devoted to his role, and thus we might assume his choice of stronghold somehow serves the Ascian agenda.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_061<tab>Or mayhap...'tis a place more dear to him than any other.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_Q1_000_000<tab>What will you say?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_A1_000_001<tab>Are you saying this was built by ancient Ascians...?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_A1_000_002<tab>Could this place provide power to Emet-Selch?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_A1_000_003<tab>I couldn't say either way...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_062<tab>That is my theory, that these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_063<tab>That was my first thought as well. Yet no matter how superior the materials, a ruin is just a ruin. 'Tis naught that would decide a battle's outcome.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_064<tab>Which brings us to my second theory: that he has some other, more personal connection to this site. What if these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_065<tab>It is my theory that these structures are remnants of a time before history─of a star that was yet whole and unbroken.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_066<tab>Such traces in the Source would have been obliterated by the succession of Umbral Calamities, but here in the First they might have remained untouched for millennia...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_067<tab>...A copy of the mural in the Qitana Ravel. Almet presented it to me during my visit to Fanow, after our victory in Kholusia.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_068<tab>Here, in the first scene... By Emet-Selch's own words, it depicts a city of eons past and the disaster which befell it.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_069<tab>The design is much simplified, of course, but do you see the similarities between its towers and those you have just inspected?
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_070<tab>We are close to the truth, I feel. Let us search the surrounds for another tower─one which matches the picture near enough to remove all doubt.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_071<tab>From what I have seen, naught more than sand and more sand lies to the east, and the south held no such structures. I suggest we try our luck further to the northwest.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_072<tab>You may view the Qitana Ravel mural at any time during this quest by using the relevant item in the <var 48 F201F4 /var><var 49 F201F5 /var>Key Items<var 49 01 /var><var 48 01 /var> menu.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_073<tab>The quest destination will not be displayed on the map. You must search for a structure which resembles the buildings in the mural, then inspect it from the survey point. The survey point will be found nearby, in a location which allows a full view of the structure.

TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_075<tab>Search for a structure which resembles one of the buildings in this mural, then inspect it from the survey point. The survey point will be found nearby, in a location which allows a full view of the structure.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_SYSTEM_000_076<tab>According to Y'shtola's investigations, the area further northwest of the Ondo Cups may be a good place to start.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_080<tab>Aye... This is the mural writ large...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_081<tab>Though I cannot guess at its purpose, it must have been an imposing sight. How much of the tower's height lies hidden beneath the ground, I wonder...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_082<tab>Centuries of our history have settled upon such ruins. Countless layers of dust and sediment...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_083<tab>...An entire civilization, its existence forgotten by all except a handful of Ascians.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_084<tab>And yet it did exist. They lived here, in this city...
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_085<tab>But let us focus on what we've learned thus far. The Ondo chieftain spoke of mysteries stirring─of a land illuminated.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_086<tab>Judging by his words, he believes this phenomenon related to the ancients' return.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_087<tab>Thus can we surmise that what the Ondo saw shining in the abyss was, in all likelihood, yet another remnant of this age-old civilization.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_088<tab>And who else would “light the lanterns” as Ryne put it, than Emet-Selch himself? 'Tis almost certain he is there!
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_090<tab>But if we are to find this stronghold in a timely manner, it seems gaining the Ondo's trust remains our swiftest path forward.
TEXT_LUCKMF106_03649_YSHTOLA_000_091<tab>I only hope our deeds are enough to win them over...
